abstract: Bipartisan Senate lawmakers have told Obama administration that they will not vote in favor of trade promotion authority bill that is crucial for Trans-Pacific Partnership, Pres Obama's number one legislative priority; senators are pushing for stronger customs enforcement to rein in abuses by China, including currency manipulation.
lead_paragraph: Democrats say they will filibuster a trade measure set for a vote Tuesday unless it is combined with a separate customs enforcement bill that would crack down on currency manipulation.

headline.main: Fight Over China Currency Policies Threatens Vote on Trade Bill
headline.print_headline: Fight Over Chinese Currency Policies Threatens Vote on Trade Bill

snippet: Democrats say they will filibuster a trade measure set for a vote Tuesday unless it is combined with a separate customs enforcement bill that would crack down on currency manipulation.
